strIntroduction: Everything you need to know about getting started on a bodyboard. You will learn the dynamics of beach break riding, using flippers, catching green waves and basic manoeuvres on the bodyboard such as turning and accelerating. Lessons will begin with a 10 minute warm up and briefing on land before launching into the water. Bodyboard rental is also available if you would like a free & easy session.
strTitle: Learn Bodyboarding in Bali

strIntroduction: Every day in the morning, our chefs visit Amlapura market to gather the produce for our menus of the day. Help carry the shopping and sample some produce while you absorb some real Balinese action in the hustle and bustle of the market. We are met with ladies seated on either sides of the walkway trying to sell their wares ... the many new sights, smell and sounds are exciting to take in. I will give you an assortment of interesting things to taste and show you the huge variety of fruit and vegetables on display alongside offerings, clay pots, basket wear and live stock. After eating our way around the market, we then drive 10 minutes to my restaurant Bali Asli, to enjoy morning tea with some of the local sweets that we chose at the market. Once we are settled, we learn how to prepare traditional flower offerings or “canang” and how to pray with them. The tasting continues as we start our cooking class by understanding the ingredients and learning how they are used for cooking, offerings and medicine. Then to the kitchen to use traditional equipment to prepare our lunch. The menu changes daily depending on what we find at the market.
strTitle: A day in the life of a Balinese lady

strIntroduction: When you are in Bali you will definitely notice that Balinese people love kites. They are flying them in the sky almost all the time. But these are not the typical kites! Many times they are as big as a human and are beautifully made. They look like a dignified creatures in the sky. Why not make your own? I invite you to join local people, to make and fly the real Balinese kite. First we will buy all the materials for you and then tell you how to make a kite. We will assist you, depending on how much help you will need. After it is done, we will go and fly your kite! First, we will explain the principles, and after that you will be able to try yourself! This is the real Balinese experience, with real people. It's a great, relaxed way to spend a day, very different from all the tourist traps. If you only want to see and feel local culture, this is an activity you must try!
strTitle: Build a Kite and Fly it like a Balinese

strIntroduction: Metaphysical healing is based on the belief that negative mental patterns left unchecked can eventually result in physical disease or illness and that transforming those negative mental patterns into positive patterns can lead to healing. This session fuses Pak Ketut’s knowledge of Chinese Medicine with his inherited Balinese healing gift of energy transmission. Scanning the body with meditative awareness, he begins a systematic rebalancing of energy by stimulating the flow of Chi, and releasing stagnant or blocked energy. Through lightly touching key points along the meridians, he stimulates and strengthens these nerve networks. Pak Ketut further addresses your body's imbalances with therapeutic acupressure. This session is recommended for boosting immunity and treating stress-related health conditions.
strTitle: Try a Metaphysical Massage

strIntroduction: Balinese traditional painting is a unique cultural heritage; sometimes a master painter will devote an entire year to the completion of one canvas. This workshop (suitable for all ages and abilities) concentrates on understanding and using the traditional motifs which give these works such depth and meaning. A totally hands-on experience, this class will take you deep into the mystery and romance which is Balinese art. Balinese traditional painting was always a two-dimensional world; using repeating figures, natural or historical or religious themes were painted with the few natural colors available to the island’s artists. When European artists discovered Bali 100 years ago their impact upon Balinese painting was immediate and fundamental. Balinese artists suddenly had access to vibrant new colors, commercial canvas, artist oil mediums and a three-dimensional visual field! The island’s artists were quick to discern the new ways of expression that were now available to them. Today, Balinese painters execute painted art in every conceivable modern expression- impressionism, expressionism, pop-art, renaissance style, cubism, abstract art and many other painting styles. Today, Bali is a popular destination for artists from all over the world who desire to immerse themselves in this unscripted artistic community. Despite the immense influence of off-island art and artists, many Balinese artists have elected to express themselves with the two-dimensional, repeating figure art of their forefathers. This art form is culturally rooted to Balinese society and thus evokes for the Balinese a more intimate connection with the artist’s efforts- more meaningful than any other acquired artistic expression. For many Balinese artists, the purpose of art is to signal the artist’s connection to Bali itself. Spend a few hours with our painting guru and get a taste for this uniquely Balinese style of painting. One can choose from a variety of traditional Balinese subjects, draw (with our help if needed) a sketch on canvas and proceed to color the subject using a painting style that has been handed down by generations of Balinese painters. Our instructor will guide you through each step so you don’t need to be an experienced artist yourself. We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Learn Traditional Balinese Painting

strIntroduction: Come and learn about the importance of permaculture principles in a fun, green and educational environment! The Island Sustainability Education Centre (ISEC) is a hidden treasure for all nature lovers searching for a place to learn, laugh, and get in touch with Mother Nature while making a positive difference. Sustainability is the way of the future and the way of NOW. So what are you waiting for? The Role Foundation 'Island Sustainability Education Centre' is a 1.5 hectare eco-learning park over-looking beautiful views of Nusa Dua in Bali. The centre aims to alleviate poverty while encouraging environmental protection by offering underprivileged Balinese individuals with free education regarding permaculture practices, waste management, English language & literacy skills, eco-tourism, sustainable micro-business management, and town planning. These students, also known as the 'Environmental Ambassadors', would love to share their invaluable knowledge with you through weekly permaculture workshops taking place at ISEC every Saturday. You will learn about the magic of renewable energy, how to turn waste into wonder, seed saving, growing healthy organic food, vermiculture, aquaculture and more! We don't just offer permaculture workshops; we offer a range of educational activities. Your participation will directly support Role Foundation projects to alleviate poverty, and protect our environment. You will see firsthand how this is working!
strTitle: Learn about Sustainable Permaculture Practices in Bali

strIntroduction: Surf in the Paradise of Bali Bali is the paradise surfing island of the world. Here you can find cool activities like yoga, cultural, spiritual, surf lifestyle and etc. Surfing is one of the most blissful experiences you can have, a pure slice of heaven. I invite you to experience and explore this bliss with us. Best Time to Surf Surfing is good all year around. The west coast, where most of the beach breaks are, is best between April and October when predominantly off shore wind makes it most perfect for surfing. Between mid November and early March the East coast becomes more favorable, however the reef breaks found here is better left for more experienced surfers. Note however that the rain season is between December and March. This can make surfing a little unpredictable during particular days. Water temperature is nice and warm all year round hovering between 21C – 25C.
strTitle: Learn to Surf and Ride Bali's Waves

strIntroduction: In my traditional Balinese Cooking Class you will: - Visit traditional markets to see the everyday art of selecting local fruits, vegetables and spices used for cooking. - Learn about the complex irrigation system, called “subak” that is used in the paddy fields. - You will be welcomed into a traditional Bali compound with a beautiful setting overlooking a deep ravine complete with organic spice plants. - You will meet the family who’s warmth will make you feel very welcome. - Make offerings for the Gods, Kuwangen and Canang Sari which area beautiful array of color and nature. - Make coconut oil, which is the best for Balinese Cooking. - Make traditional Balinese spice paste used as a Base for many dishes – very fragrant and a sensation for your taste buds. - You will learn a lot in a short time. - No experience necessary.
strTitle: From the Market to the Kitchen: Learn Balinese Cooking

strIntroduction: Bali is a world surfing mecca and has developed into a bustling epicenter where surfers either start or end their world surfing 'surfaries'. Until now very few learn to surf programs have been established in Bali. The Bali Learn to Surf School, as the first surf school in Bali, has embraced this opportunity, developing a highly professional outfit teaching people the experience of surfing ensuring that surf etiquette, surf safety and minimal impact to the ocean and surrounding land environments is bestowed upon the students taking part. We provide a variety of surf courses for kids and adults. Choose the surf course that is best for you in the option box! - Level 1 - Intro To Surfing (2.5h) During this lesson you will learn basic board skills, padding, take off, riding a wave, surf safety, surf etiquette and you will be standing and surfing by the end of this lesson. - Level 2 - Nomad (3 Lessons) You will be surfing waves in 3 lessons. We teach you in this course board handling and boardcontrol, surf awareness understanding beach, wave and ocean conditions and surf safety. Preparing you too feel safe and confident in the surf. - Level 3 - Surfer (6 Lessons) *Photo and surf certificate are included in this course In this course we progress you through levels and skills to have you catching and surfing unbroken waves, taking the drop, ridding the wave face, bottom and top turns, positioning in the line upand advanced surf safety. This is the course for anyone serious about becoming a surfer. - Private Lesson (2h) - Kids Club Level 1 - Grommet (1 Lesson) Under 12yrs - 2 Hour Group Lesson • Intro to Surfing and Surf Safety. • Kids learn beach and surf safety and awareness. • Basic board skills, paddling, catching waves and surfstance. • Stand up and surf assisted by our professional coaches in your first lesson. - Kids Club Level 2 - Dolphin (3 Lessons) Under 12yrs - 2 Hour Group Lesson • In this course kids learn about rules in the surf and beingsafe in the surf • Preparing them to feel safe and confident, catching waves assisted by our professional surf coaches • They will learn how to ride and turn on a wave and have heaps of fun and make new friends - Kids Club Level 3 - Pro Surfer (6 Lessons) Under 12yrs - 2 Hour Group Lesson *Surf certificate and photo are included in this course Become a real Surfer in this course. Learn how the Pro surf tricks, turns and safety tips from our professional surf coaches.
strTitle: Learn to Surf with the Best Instructors in Bali

strIntroduction: In the still of the misty forest of Taro Elephant Park at nightfall, our elephants take you on Bali’s first twilight elephant trek, Safari Under the Stars. A Specially designed Safari Under the Stars trail offers a different course than our day-time elephant safari rides and makes for a completely new enchanted elephant experience. Enjoy a magical Elephant Talent Show at dusk before a night ride through the dimly lit forest and a four course dinner in our Pachyderm Palm Grove by the lake. SAFARI UNDER THE STARS: PICKUP Nusa Dua 02.30-03.00 pm Kuta/Seminyak 03.00-03.30 pm Sanur 03.00-03.30 pm Ubud 04.30-05.00 pm ITINERARY 15.00 Hotel Pick Up 17.30 Arriving at the Elephant Safari Park, Taro & Registration Process 17.45 Visiting Museum and Elephant Discovery Information Centre 18.00 Feeding the Elephants and Baby Elephants 18.20 Park Tours 18.45 Elephant Talent Show 19.00 Elephant Safari Night Ride 19.30 Dinner 21.00 Depart from ESPL You can also enjoy an afternoon of rafting down the Ayung River followed by a night safari through the forest of Taro. Tour includes Transfers, Rafting, Park Entry, Elephant Safari Night Ride, Show, Dinner, Insurance RAFTING (AFTERNOON) + NIGHT SAFARI + DINNER PICKUP Nusa Dua 11.30 - 12.00 pm Kuta/Seminyak 11.30 - 12.00 pm Sanur 12.00 - 12.30 pm Ubud 12.30 - 01.00 pm ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Bring spare clothes ITINERARY 13.30 Arriving at the Rafting Starting Point and Registration Process 13.45 Buffet Lunch at the Canopy (food only) 14.30 Shuttle to Start Point of Rafting 14.45 Preparation/Outfitting and Briefing from the Guide 15.00 Rafting 17.15 Shower and Changes 17.45 Depart from BAR 18.15 Arriving at the Elephant Safari Park 18.30 Feeding the Elephants and Baby Elephants 18.45 Elephant Talent Show 19.00 Elephant Safari Night Ride 19.30 Dinner 21.00 Depart from ESPL
strTitle: 25% OFF Safari Under the Stars with Taro Elephant Park Bali

strIntroduction: A Bali Honeymoon package like no other, these luxury experiences are guaranteed to have you falling in love all over again. Falling in love and getting married is an incredible experience but nothing beats the I-can’t-keep-my-hands-off-you honeymoon. It’s an extraordinary time when your partner can be the only thing you can focus on. The entire world feels like it’s been reduced to you two. With its laid-back atmosphere and dreamy landscapes, Bali is the perfect destination for the honeymoon. Whilst there are many opportunities for romance, a must-have for every honeymoon package is a day of luxury experiences. Carefully crafted with select experiences that have been verified and come highly recommended, whatever your dream honeymoon entails, you'll find a package that suits you below. All these packages include your private driver/guide all day long. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Package 1 : Ubud Honeymoon Package 1. 9AM - 12NN Private Tour of Ubud (Including 1-Hour Couple Photo shooting) Your guide will bring you around Ubud and the surroundings including the famous Goa Gajah, Tirta Empul & the Monkey Forest. With 1 hour Couple Photo shooting at Campuhan Ridge. 2. 1PM - 3PM Visit at Tegallalang Rice Terraces (Including 1-Hour Couple Photo shooting) Beautiful and pristine, the Tegallalang Rice Terraces are left alone by the crowds that throng other parts of Bali. These gentle green terraces are UNESCO World Heritage Site and over 500 years old. 3. 4PM - 5PM Balinese Massage at the Mango Tree Spa by L'Occitane Every gesture, every ingredient, every ritual is drawn from a page of the L’Occitane grand herbarium, a resource of hundreds of essential oils and natural ingredients. 4. 6PM - 9PM Romantic Twilight Dinner 5-star Kupu Kupu Barong Villas Share a romantic evening with a loved one on a unique floating dining setting under a canopy of stars. A five-course gourmet menu will be discreetly served throughout the duration of this unforgettable evening. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Package 2 : Uluwatu / Nusa Dua Honeymoon Package 1. 9AM - 11AM Day Tour to see Uluwatu Temple Uluwatu Temple, or Pura Luhur Uluwatu, one of six key temples believed to be Bali's spiritual pillars, is renowned for its magnificent location, perched on top of a steep cliff approximately 70 metres above sea level. 2. 12NN - 2PM Access to Padang Padang Beach and Suluban Beach.. 3. 3PM - 430PM Create your own Luxury Perfume Learn how to make your own perfume and create a unique personalized fragrance using the finest essences available in Indonesia. Create your own bespoke fragrance to take home or as a gift. 4. 530PM - 930PM Oceanfront Candlelight Dinner On a Cliff Celebrate a special moment together in Bali with a candlelight dinner at the stunning 5-star cliffside Anantara resort in Uluwatu. With the sweeping Indian Ocean before you and twinkling stars overhead, this will surely be an evening of romance to remember. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Just let us know which package you would like and we will take care of everything else!
strTitle: Bali Honeymoon Package - 1 Day Of Luxury Experiences

strIntroduction: This day class is perfect for beginners with no previous experience at jewellery making. We hold your hand right from the beginning all the way through to the end. This is a full day out of 6 hours (including lunch and 8 grams of high quality 925 silver). It is a full day of learning and making. You will make your dream piece, something you will wear everyday as a memory of this great day out! This workshop is highly professional and taught by English speakers from Portugal and UK. Arriving at the studio (to keep this class affordable transport is not included but can be organised at extra cost) you will be greeted with a cold fresh tropical juice and an introduction to the day's activities ahead. Flip through our library of great jewellery and contemporary design books to get inspiration. Learn the properties of silver, by following a simple annealing (heating) test. Work with some wire to twist and turn and understand the tools you will be using throughout the day. Try out different textures and shapes to create your base to the piece. There is no limit to what you can make; a ring, a pair of earrings a pendant, it's up to you! Break for a healthy and yummy lunch of salads, pastas and quiches followed by fruit plates and amazing gourmet cakes and coffee. 45 minutes to take in the beautiful garden around you and then back to working on your dream piece. Finish off by filing and polishing your piece with the hand held polisher and getting it ready for photos. Package your piece for a present for a friend or yourself in our beautiful and traditional Bali jewellery collectable tins. Rest a little and take in the amazing day you just had. Smile. This is one of the best things you can do in Bali while on holiday!
strTitle: The Island's Best Silver Jewellery Making Full Day Workshop

strIntroduction: Be prepared to be spoiled on this amazing day out for 6 packed hours of learning and fun rolled into one! There is nothing better than being able to make the rings that you will give to each other on your special day. Make them personal, make them different, make them together and make the bond of the day here on the beautiful island of Bali entwined in them for eternity. This special day includes: all workshop facilities and tutoring 8 grammes of silver amazing gourmet lunch and bottle of bubbles/wine Allow 6 - 7 hours for this workshop. Learn: Sawing, shaping, filing, annealing and soldering, as well as texture and hammering. Silver is included in this workshop for 8 grammes each. If you wish to do your rings in gold (18 and 24 carat) we are able to organise this in advance for you by email. Prices are at exchange rate on the day but a rough estimate is $60 USD per gram for 18 and $80 USD per gram for 24. A ladies ring is estimated at 5 - 7 grammes and a man's at 8 - 10 grammes. The price we quote is for the workshop, tutoring, use of all facilities, lunch by the pool, (8 grammes of silver each) pool use and bottle of bubbles or wine (your choice - in advance by email also) This will be a day to remember!
strTitle: Luxury Couples Engagement/Wedding Ring Workshop in Sanur

strIntroduction: Every treatment will begin with a foot bath while enjoying a glass of lime, cucumber, mint and honey which will help you to relax, followed by a purification ritual of the Tibetan singing bowl to clear away negative vibrations, allowing fresh new chi to enter and opens up the chakra. Facial : Cleanse, exfoliate, mask, followed by a revitalizing neck, upper chest, neck-shoulder, hand and feet massage. Organic Facial (60 minutes) Custom-made recipes using fresh local organic ingredients to cleanse, refine, restore and hydrate your skin. > Normal to Oily Scrub: balinese coffee powder Mask: strawberry (green tea), honey and yoghurt Coffee is full of antioxidants, unclog the pores, and revitalize skin cells, while gentle facemask will help remove toxins from your skin. > Normal to Dry Scrub: cocoa powder Mask: milk and frangipani petals cream Cocoa powder properties : prevent free radicals, exfoliate and invigorate the skin. Milk and frangipani mask leaving it silky smooth and improve your skin’s elasticity. > Sensitive Scrub: honey and aloe vera Mask: cucumber, aloe vera and spinach Aloe vera has its own natural way of soothing sensitive skin, resulting to stronger tissues and healthier skin. Golden Spoon Facial (90 minutes) This rejuvenating facial uses the golden spoon therapy and bio-light ultrasonic induction method to reduce fine lines, lighten dark eye circles, and help skin become more radiant. This treatment includes serum mask and golden spoon massage to improve facial circulation and regenerate beautiful skin. Cooling Jade Facial (90 minutes) Inspired by the beauty and radiant skin of Chinese Empress, this opulent anti-aging treatment lavishes your skin with pure Pearl Extract to improve elasticity and increase skin oxygenation. This treatment includes Pearl Extract mask and Jade roller massage. Each session will end with Tibetan prayer bells which cleanse your mind, giving you a sense of uplift and relaxation.
strTitle: Luxury Spa Bali : Facial Rejuvenation At Amala Spa, Seminyak

strIntroduction: We believe that learning to surf takes personalized attention. This is why why limit groups to 3 students per instructor. We provide all surf equipment and all participants of all surf experience are invited to join our surf lessons. Beginners are welcome. The only requirement is to be able to swim for 50 minutes. YOUR SCHEDULE : - 08:00 AM Pick up at your hotel lobby to Sanur - 09:30 AM departure of the speedboat to Lembongan - 11:00 AM Start of the surf lesson (time can vary according to tide & swell) - 2:00 PM lunch at Pisang-Pisang Restaurant with yummy smoothies - 3:00 PM free time to explore the island - 4:00 PM departure of the speedboat to Bali - 5:30 PM return at your hotel
strTitle: Learn To Surf Bali : 1 Day Surfing Lesson Trip to Lembongan

strIntroduction: Fly from our heliport in Benoa over the Kuta coastline and Tanah Lot temple to view the majestic Batur crater - the remains of a huge explosion that occurred thousands of years ago. Lake Batur, Bali's largest lake, is situated within this crater, next to a younger active volcano, and the unique terrain makes for jawdropping photos from above. After our visit to the volcano, we return south to the heliport, but not before a little flight over Ubud's wild river gorges and stunning rice fields. ************************************ 60 MINUTE CHARTER: Sights you will see: - Kuta beach coastline passing Tanah Lot temple - the volcanic crater of Mount Batur and Lake Batur - Ubud and its scenic villages and rice fields [Weight Limit - 407KG] ************************************ NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the appropriate pick up time at your hotel (complimentary round trip transfer is offered to guests staying in Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian and Sanur). - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: Private Bali Helicopter Tour - Kintamani Volcano

strIntroduction: Part of a trio of islands off Bali's southeastern coast, Nusa Lembongan is a pristine tropical island with crystal clear waters that make for wonderful snorkelling. With its highest point at 50 meters above sea level, it is famous for its rugged coastline and jungle-like scenery from above. This 15 min flight (one way) from Bali to Nusa Lembongan will help you get there in the quickest and most efficient manner, so you have the rest of the day to explore the island. If you would like to enjoy the same helicopter ride back to Bali, please book this one-way transfer twice. *********************************** 30 MINUTE PRIVATE TRANSFER TO NUSA LEMBONGAN Sights we will see along the way: - Bali's eastern coastline - Nusa Lembongan Island from above - Nusa Ceningan Island and it's seaweed farms [Weight Limit - 457KG] ************************************ NOTE: - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: Private Helicopter Transfer from Bali to Nusa Lembongan

strIntroduction: Fly via the famous Kuta beach coastline on Bali's southwest coast, passing Tanah Lot temple as you head north to the breathtaking volcanic crater of Mount Batur. Lake Batur, Bali's largest lake, is situated within this crater, next to this young active volcano which takes your breath away from above. As we have ample time on this trip, we will take you to explore this sometimes smoking volcano by circling the crater (bring your camera for those unforgettable shots!) Our return journey then heads back over Ubud, highlighting its surrounding villages, river gorges and the beautiful patterns of ·its rice fields. [Total weight limit: 407KG including luggage] NOTE: - If you have less than 4 in your group, the start time for your shared flight charter will be dependant upon the other guests whom you we are combining you with. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the possibilities. - Please be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video

Fly up to the iconic Tanah Lot temple, said to be guarded against intruders by mythical sea snakes. Next, we fly over some gorgeous rice terraces and then proceed towards the southern bukit peninsula, passing over the jawdropping Uluwatu Temple, which is situated on a 90 meters limestone cliff facing the Indian Ocean. ************************************************************ 40 MINUTE PRIVATE FLIGHT Possible Sights : - Kuta & Legian Beach - Tanah Lot Temple - Rice Terraces - Uluwatu Temple - Bukit (Peninsula) Coastline - Jimbaran Bay - Dreamland Beach - Seaweed Farms - Garuda Wisnu Kencana Statue [Weight Limit - 442 KG] ************************************************************* NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the appropriate pick up time at your hotel (complimentary round trip transfer is offered to guests staying in Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian and Sanur). - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: Private Helicopter Tour - Explore Bali's Temples & Coastline

strIntroduction: Bali's southern coastline is famous for its dramatic cliffside and sweeping views of the Indian Ocean. We will soar over Uluwatu temple, one of the island's most spectacular Hindu edifices, situated on a limestone cliff 90 meters above the sea. After, we fly past Jimbaran Bay, famous for the freshest seafood in Bali and its perfect crescent beach. Get ready to experience uninterrupted views of seaweed farms, limestone cliffs and deserted beaches along the way. We will then hover right above the famous Garuda Wisnu Kencana before turning north towards the airport and back to our heliport. ************************************************************ 30 MINUTE PRIVATE ULUWATU FLIGHT: Sights we will see: - Uluwatu Temple - Bukit (Peninsula) Coastline - Jimbaran Bay - Dreamland Beach - Seaweed Farms - Garuda Wisnu Kencana Statue [Weight Limit - 457 KG] ************************************************************* NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. strIntroduction: Whether you'd like to swing by the soaring cliffs of Uluwatu or fly over the majestic Kintamani volcano, charter our helicopter for the ride of your life! The flight is valid for a maximum of 6 passengers but subject to a total payload limitation for passengers and luggage per below. ************************************ 30 MINUTE CHARTER: Suggested sights: - Sanur - Tabanan rice terraces - Tanah Lot - Seminyak [Total weight Limit - 457KG] ************************************ 60 MINUTE CHARTER: Suggested sights: - Jimbaran Bay - Dreamland Beach - Uluwatu temple and its jaw dropping cliffs - Kuta beach coastline passing Tanah Lot temple - The volcanic crater of Mount Batur, Lake Batur (we can explore this sometimes smoking volcano by circling the crater and then return over Ubud) - Ubud's scenic villages and rice fields [Total weight limit - 407KG] ************************************ NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. strTitle: Bali Helicopter Tour - Private Charter

strIntroduction: This exclusive 90 minute flight is one of our most recommended options to take in the best of Bali. After 30 minutes of scenic flight time via Tanah Lot Temple on the west coast over the island’s wonderfully diverse landscape, we arrive at the volcanic crater of Mt. Batur. This crater is the remains of a huge explosion that occurred thousands of years ago. Lake Batur, Bali's largest lake, is situated within this crater, next to a younger active volcano. The small volcano is constantly recreating itself in periodic eruptions of ash and rock. We explore this sometimes-smoking volcano by circling the crater before proceeding east, flying over Lake Batur and past Mt. Abang, reaching Besakih temple, Bali's largest and most sacred temple complex. The helicopter now starts to climb to an astonishing 11,000 ft. to reach the crater of Mt. Agung - Bali's holiest peak. Upon reaching the top, we circle the crater and then start to descend towards Besakih temple at the foot of the mountain. On a clear day, Mt. Rinjani, on the neighboring island of Lombok, is actually visible from the helicopter. On the return journey to the Heliport, we pass numerous rivers, valleys, hotels and villas and of course – luscious rice fields. Prior to landing, the route takes us via the eastern coastline to take in the peaceful beaches of Sanur. ************************************ 90 MINUTE PRIVATE FLIGHT Sights we will cover: - Kuta beach coastline passing Tanah Lot temple - the volcanic crater of Mount Batur, Lake Batur - Mt Abang - Mt Agung Crater (Bali's highest point) - Besakih (Mother Temple of Bali - largest and most important of Bali's 9 directional temlpes) - Ubud rice fields - Sanur and Benoa coastline [Weight Limit - 347KG] ************************************ NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the appropriate pick up time at your hotel (complimentary round trip transfer is offered to guests staying in Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian and Sanur). - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: Private Bali Helicopter - *Superior* Kintamani Volcano Tour

strIntroduction: This 60 minute flight will take you over some of Bali's most celebrated and beautiful spots in the noth. Beratan Lake is a shallow lake about 1231m above sea level, nestled in the Bedugul area, one of Bali's most famous and beautiful destinations. The lake is 3.8 km2 wide and up-to 22 meters deep, with a beautiful regal temple (Pura Ulun Danu Beratan) you often see in postcards. Forget the crowds below and experience the lake and it's world famous temple with uninterrupted and awe-inspiring views that will give you memories to last a lifetime! ************************************ 60 MINUTE PRIVATE FLIGHT Possible sights: - Bedugul area and Jatiluwih rice terraces - Pura Ulun Danu Beratan - Lake Beratan - Mt Agung - Lush rivers and rice paddies [Weight Limit - 407KG] ************************************ NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the appropriate pick up time at your hotel (complimentary round trip transfer is offered to guests staying in Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian and Sanur). - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: Private Bali Helicopter Tour of Lake Beratan

strIntroduction: Famed for its beauty and isolation, Lombok’s Mt. Rinjani is Indonesia's second highest volcano. At 3,726 meters, it towers over Lombok, drawing thousands of visitors who attempt to scale its peak every year. While the hike up the volcano takes several nights to conquer on foot, take our painless and stress-free scenic route and hop over to Lombok on our helicopter! This breathtaking flight takes you across the sea and east to Bali's famous neighbour, heading north on Lombok towards this majestic volcano. The volcano itself boasts a ten-kilometer-wide crater - a habitat with deep gorges, towering walls, hot springs, waterfalls, and a perfectly shaped volcanic cone. This stratovolcano’s oval-shaped Segara Anak caldera also contains a beautiful 230-m-deep lake, which you can marvel at from the air. [Total weight allowed: 277kg including any bags or luggage] *********************************** NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the appropriate pick up time at your hotel (complimentary round trip transfer is offered to guests staying in Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian and Sanur). - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: Private Helicopter Tour to Mount Rinjani

strIntroduction: Avoid the crowds getting on the boats at Serangan or Padang Bai harbors and hop on our helicopter for a quick jaunt from Bali to Gili Trawangan in just 45 minutes. As we fly along the east coast of Bali, you will be able to see Bali's most sacred mountain - Mount Agung - to your left and one of Bali's neighboring islands - Nusa Lembongan - to your right. As we approach Gili T, Mount Rinjani, Indonesia's second highest volcano, can be seen close by on neighboring Lombok dominating the views towards the East. [Total weight allowed: 437kg including any bags or luggage] *********************************** NOTE: - The start time for your private charter is full flexible as long as we have availability. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the appropriate pick up time at your hotel (complimentary round trip transfer is offered to guests staying in Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Kuta, Legian and Sanur). - Please be ready at your hotel on time so that you can be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: Private Helicopter Transfer from Bali to the Gili Islands

strIntroduction: Choose from 3 proposal packages below to make your next romantic trip to Bali truly spectacular: OPTION 1: PROPOSAL FROM THE AIR - 15 min flight 15 minute helicopter ride starting from Benoa Heliport straight to the Nusa Dua area where we will then fly over the giant letters "WILL YOU MARRY ME (insert your partner's name)?" on the lawn at Taman Bhagawan Tanjung Benoa. Max weight: 487kg, with a maximum of 5 passengers (so you can even bring your partner's parents or friends if you would like!) OPTION 2: PROPOSAL FROM THE AIR - 30 min flight 30 minute helicopter tour starting at Benoa heliport, flying over Jimbaran Bay, Uluwatu temple on a cliff and then Nusa Dua with a final flight over the giant letters "WILL YOU MARRY ME (insert your partner's name)?" on the lawn at Taman Bhagawan Tanjung Benoa. Maximum weight is 457 kg, with a maximum of 5 passengers on board OPTION 3: PRIVATE PICNIC ON THE BEACH - 20 min flight 10 minute helicopter ride starting from Benoa Heliport to the secluded Nyang Nyang beach in Uluwatu where you'll see the words "Will You Marry Me?" written into the sand. After landing, you can get down on your knee to pop the question and then choose to take a romantic stroll on the beach or add-on a picnic basket and arrangement at an extra charge. 10 minute return flight to Benoa heliport after the stopover. Max weight: 477kg total, with a maximum of 5 passengers OPTION 4: PROPOSAL FROM THE AIR ATOP MT. BATUR - 60 min flight 1 hour helicopter ride starting from Benoa heliport to Mt. Batur; on the way you'll get the chance to view the iconic Tanah Lot temple from the air. As you sweep up the coastline, you'll glimpse upon amazing views of the rugged terrain of the Kintamani area and reach Mount Batur's crater, where you'll hover over our team will be holding a banner reading "Will You Marry Me?". Additional perks can also be arranged below (just include them when going through the booking process) 1. A bouquet of flowers 2. One bottle of sparkling wine
strTitle: Romantic Helicopter Proposal from the Air

strIntroduction: If you've chosen Bali for your next corporate retreat, let our destination experts customize an unforgettable day of team building activities for you! Designed to allow team members to explore the island while having fun and overcoming challenges together, our itineraries range from just a few hours to an entire day. Our past clients range from large multinational corporations to SMEs and startups, so whatever your budget, reach out to us and let us create a proposal based on your requirements. Our previous clients include the management teams of Facebook, Airbnb, RGF and more, so rest assured you are in good hands! A quick taste of some of the challenges we have created in the past: 1. Scavenger hunt - score points as you discover local landmarks and hidden locations all over the island. Depending on where you are staying, we can select spots that fit into your desired time frame! 2. Food hunt - track down some must-try local delicacies like Babi Guling (roast suckling pig) and Ayam Betutu (a local favourite of stewed chicken with Balinese spices) 3. 'A Day in the Life of a Hawker' - try your hand at selling local snacks as a team and get your creative marketing juices flowing! 4. Artistic challenges - Bali is an island full of art & culture. Try your hand at making offerings, weaving hats, wood carving and more as you race to win points! If you're feeling up the challenge, we'll even make you play local musical instruments as an orchestra or learn a traditional Balinese dance!
strTitle: Bali Team Building: Organize a Customized Amazing Race

strIntroduction: One of our handpicked drivers will be waiting for you at the airport arrival lobby with your name on a placard so you can easily find them once you exit the baggage claim area. Once your driver picks you up at the airport, you'll be provided with mineral water and a cold towel so you can hydrate and refresh yourself from your journey into Bali. All you have to do is sit back, relax and enjoy the comfortable one hour smooth drive where you will be dropped off right at your hotel lobby. Note: The Bali Mandara Toll Road fee is included within the price. No need for spare change.
strTitle: Private Airport Transfer to/from Your Nusa Dua Hotel

strIntroduction: Stay at our family run guest house, engage in a yoga retreat and enjoy our permaculture garden. Itinerary: Arrive early in the morning and join a yoga class. After class, cool off with a fresh mixed or specialized juice at our restaurant. For lunch, try the weekly special, the dish changes every week and is always prepared according to season. With the meals being healthy, low in fat and rich in nutrients, you will not feel stuffed. Decide to cycle around Canggu or read a book from our sharing library; find your niche near the pool or around the Cozy corner. You have been reading for a few hours and decide you need some real relaxation you can book yourself a massage at the reception. Having a day full of activities, sleep in either a budget or superior room (with airconditioning or fan), built of eco friendly materials. Located only 15 minutes from the most popular tourist areas like Kuta and Seminyak and 30 minute from the Ngurah Rai international Airport; our Eco Guesthouse gives our clients a chance to relax in total tranquility and having the most popular tourist areas of Bali within their reach. The most friendly guesthouse in Bali.
strTitle: Yoga Class and Eco Stay in Canggu Bali

strIntroduction: Menjangan Island is located within the West Bali National Park, a marine protected area in the northwestern part of Bali. Well known for its magnificent underwater world, turtles and remarkable wall diving, the warm waters of Menjangan Island present an amazing experience for divers of all experience levels. Surrounded by coral reef with deep drop offs and complex rock formations, Menjangan Island has a unique underwater landscape, which plays host to fish of every size, shape and color! The sea beds are also rich in large barrel sponges and vibrant sea fans, some of which are truly enormous. Given the depth, the moderate flow of currents and its protection from strong winds, it is common to see tuna, shoals of jack-fish, batfish, angelfish, sea turtles, and on occasion also sharks, especially off the outer corners of the island. Boasting an average year round visibility of 20 – 30 meters, Menjangan island is the perfect backdrop for 2 days of fantastic diving with our experienced instructors. ROUGH ITINERARY OF YOUR TWO DAYS: DAY 1: - 06.30 : Pick up from your hotel lobby, drive for 4 hours to Pemuteran. - 10.30 : Arrive at the Harbor then board the boat to Menjangan Island. - 11.00 : Arrive at Menjangan Island. 1st Dive. - 12.30 : Lunch at Menjangan Island - 13.30 : 2nd dive - 15.00 : Head to one of our partner hotels in Pemuteran - 16.00 : Arrive at the hotel, relax and enjoy the end of your 1st day DAY 2: - 11.00 : 1st dive - 12.30 : Lunch at Menjangan Island - 13.30 : 2nd dive - 15.00 : Leave for your hotel in Bali - 19.00 : Arrive at your hotel (approximate time) ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES: Additional dive (on the same day only) : US$ 40 Single supplement charge : US$ 49 Snorkeler / Non diving companion : US$ 49 MORE ABOUT SPECIFIC DIVE SITES AT MENJANGAN ISLAND: 1. At a depth of 45 meters - we find the Anchor wreck. Also called the Anker or Kapal Budak (Slave Ship), the site is an old wooden ship wreck sitting on the sea floor on the western tip of Menjangan which is either an 19th century Dutch ship that sunk during WWII or one that sunk much earlier during the Dutch colonial era while supposedly carrying Balinese slaves to Batavia (now Jakarta). The wreck contains a cargo of ceramics and glass bottles and is completely colonized by soft coral; an excellent place to meet turtles and sharks. 2. Named after a large colony of garden eels, the Eel Gardens dive site lies on the western point of Menjangan in a shallow area with some dazzling white sand. The dive starts on a nice wall (about 40m) with a lot of beautiful gorgonians and other sea fans then continue over the top of the reef to a stretch of white sand. Arguably, some say that this is the best part of Menjangan Island. 3. There is a big surprise for macro-photographers, video-operators and marine biologists at the Secret Bay”. In the small bay near the ferry port of Gilimanuk, a strange play in currents has rendered the water temperature here to be more, at most 25 degree C, which has created a habitat for Pacific and Indian Ocean species, with often hybrids between the two. The muddy shallow beds, mixed with algae and debris, are host to truly strange marine creatures, some of which have recently been discovered by marine biologists for the first time. The bay is also host to numerous different sea horses, dragonets, ghostpipefish, nudibranches, lionfish such as the Blue Finned lionfish, ribbon eels and much more. This unique bay has been and still is the preferred location of some of the world’s most famous underwater photographers and filmmakers, as well as researchers and marine biologists. Credit for detailed dive site information: Wonderful Indonesia
strTitle: Explore Menjangan Island on an Overnight Dive Trip

REVITALISING BATH WITH CHAMPAGNE (15 minutes): Swirl inside our Fresh Lime & Basil Revitalizing Bath. 9. SNACK TIME (at your leisure): Aphrodisiac snacks served at our indoor bar or outside on one of our day beds. ******************************* SNACK MENU - comprising mini-versions of dishes from our spa menu such as below (subject to availability): - Vietnamese Rice Paper Rolls with Sous vide Lobster tails, organic sprouts, pickled daikon - Grilled Ciabatta - Marinated mixed olives, citrus, lemon thyme, virgin olive oil - Wild Forest Mushroom Pizza - Truffle mascarpone, baby rocket, salsa verde - Freshly Shucked Imported Oysters with chilli-lime, sesame dipping, lemon cheeks - Sugar Cured Salmon with Green Olive Tapenade, tropical salsa, sourdough crostini - Seared Alaskan Scallops with Cauliflower Purée, saffron capellini, caper-raisin vinaigrette ******************************* 10. MAD HATTER'S TEA PARTY (OPTIONAL) - available from 2.30 - 5pm Our special tea party menu, crafted by the formidable pastry chef Adriano Zumon, pays homage to Alice in Wonderland's famous 'mad hatters' tea party. Quirky and whimsical, our colourful 'cage' of sweets and treats will surely tantalise your tastebuds as you enjoy the view of the crashing waves from our lounge. Freshly brewed tea and coffee accompanies your tea time set. ** If you would like to add the Mad Hatter's Tea Party to your spa package, we recommend starting your treatment at approximately 12 noon.
