strIntroduction: Charter our luxury catamaran and leisurely sail from Benoa Harbour in Bali across deep blue sea to the island of Nusa Lembongan, where you'll be greeted by our beach club on its dazzling white sand beaches. Time on board is entirely tailored to you; you can choose to lounge and sun bathe with drinks, cheese, and crackers, or even participate by learning to sail the yacht! Once on the scenic island of Nusa Lembongan, you can choose from a range of activities or you can simply relax at the beach club and avail of its facilities. In the afternoon an extensive buffet lunch will be served, after which you'll get the chance to enjoy more activities or relax before the local boats return to ferry you back to the catamaran for a leisurely sail home. == The Itinerary == 7:30 - 8:00am Pickup from your hotel 9:00am Depart from Benoa Harbour 10:45am Arrive at our beach club on Lembongan Island, where you can make full use of the facilities (see below) 11:00am Participate in the wide range of activities offered at our beach club (see below) 1pm : Buffet lunch (menu below) with a glass of wine or beer, soft drinks, mineral water, tea & coffee 2:15pm Take part in a second round of activities or laze by the pool if you prefer just to relax 3:15pm Depart from Lembongan Island- enjoy a sunset cocktail, cheese & crackers on the way back 5pm Arrive at Benoa Harbour and get dropped off at your hotel to end the perfect day out with your group == The Boat / Journey == This 20 tonne, 16 meter catamaran is one of the most luxurious that you'll ride here in Bali with a 5-star crew of 5 people! Facilities include 2 troll fishing rods, plenty of space to relax and sunbathe, an open deck to enjoy the gorgeous weather, and an inner lounge with music that's a perfect space for beating the heat! Once on board, you'll be greeted with a welcome drink, pastries, soft drinks, tea & coffee, slice fruit, and a cool towel before setting off across the Badung straight to the white sand beaches of Nusa Lembongan island. On the way back, we set sail into the sunset with cocktails for your group which perfectly go along with the cheese and crackers to snack on. This is one experience you definitely won't forget - we hope to welcome your group aboard to sail with us sometime soon! == Beach Club Facilities == Our beach club is located on a gorgeous stretch of Nusa Lembongan's white sand beach and comes with 5-star facilities including a pool, volleyball court, table tennis tables, chess and backgammon sets, bicycles, boogie board, canoes, and restaurant. Activities offered by our beach club include snorkeling, glass bottom boat tours, village tours which take in the famous underground house of a local hermit, banana boat rides, and mangrove tours. Of course, you can always simply laze by the pool or enjoy the crystal clear water at the beach! We even have a spa (for an additional charge) which offers an intimate range of Balinese treatments including massages, manicures, pedicures and our famous cream baths. Scrubs, massage oils and spa products are sourced from natural, locally produced ingredients to reflect the sea, the sand and the earth in tropical island style. Amidst this day of relaxation, you'll leave feeling divine! Our beach club is also the venue for your amazing BBQ! == Beach BBQ Menu == Salads Bowls of fresh and crisp tossed salads Selection of fresh homemade dressings Carrot and apple salad with sesame seed dressing Herb potato salad Penne pasta salad Assorted breads and garlic croutons Char Grill Tuna steak Marlin fillet Chicken satay Beef satay Hot Buffett Balinese style vegetable curry Fragrant mixed seafood curry Baked potatoes Steamed white rice Work fried egg noodles Selection of assorted dips and condiments Desserts Assorted tropical fruits Nagasari rice cake with banana Dadar Gulung traditional pandan flavoured crepes Served with a glass of wine or beer, soft drinks, mineral water, tea & coffee == Boat Specifications == Type: Sailing Catamaran Flag: Indonesia Completed : January 20, 2005 Construction: Fibre Glass Gross Tonnage: 20 tonnes Overall Length: 16.6 meters Overall Width: 9.62 meters Draft: 1.90 meters Power: 2 x Steyr 140 HP Maximum Speed: 18 knots Crew: 5 People Maximum Capacity: 30 Passengers Safety: Complies with ISM-Code
strTitle: Bali Full Day Private Luxury Yacht Charter for 30 People

strIntroduction: Have you ever wanted to travel all of Indonesia but never had time to do so? Well look no further, the Taman Nusa Indonesian Cultural Heritage Centre is a collection of over 60 different Indonesian homes either brought from their original locations or recreated replicas built from their authentic blueprints. This educational and awe inspiring tour is located just outside the Gianyar Rengency (approximately 1.5 hours from Kuta, Seminyak and Legian). Take a walk back in time to the Prehistoric Era of Indonesia through the Bronze Age and right into the Kingdom Age (where you can find the famous Borobudur Temple - a replica of a 9th century old Mahayana Buddhist Temple). Visit the Kehen Temple (built in the 11th century) formerly known as the fire temple guarded by the fire god (Brahmen). Then you will visit the Penglipuran village (a traditional Balinese compound) with little influence of modern technology. Have lunch over looking the Kintamani volcano valley. Finish the day off with a visit to Titra Empul the purification temple and on the way home stop at the Tegalalang Rice Terraces for a photo-op! ITINERARY: 08.30 - Pick up from your hotel lobby 09.15 - Arrive at Taman Nusa Cultural Heritage Centre (entrance fee $29 / adult, $19/ child). 10.45 - Visit the Kehen Temple 11.00 - Stop over at the Penglipuran traditional village 12.00 - Have lunch by Kintamani volcano 14.15 - Arrive at the purification temple (Titra Empul) 16.00 - Try the famous Luwak coffee 17.00 - Leave for the UNESCO Tegalang rice terraces 18.00 - Return to your hotel PICK UP TIMES: Nusa Dua : 08.30 AM Kuta/Seminyak : 09.00 AM Ubud/Sanur/Denpasar: 09.00 AM
strTitle: Visit the Taman Nusa Indonesian Cultural Heritage Centre

strIntroduction: Calling all adventure and authenticity seekers! Come spend the night at a truly unique place in Bali. Our Sumba house is made entirely out of bamboo, while staying true to the aesthetics of its original architecture, making it completely sustainable yet comfortable. As background, Sumba is located in eastern Indonesia in the province of East Nusa Tenggara. The island is famous for its megalithic tombs, hand-woven Ikat, and the annual Pasola festival, an ancient war ritual war where groups of men riding their decorated horses fling wooden spears at each other to ask for the blessings of the gods for a good harvest. In Sumba, traditional architecture is closely related to the age-old Marapu culture and the house is not only seen as a mere dwelling place, but is regarded as a symbol of the cosmos linking the divine world to that of Man. The wooden beams on the roof are believed to be the entrance for the ancestor spirits to enter the house and give blessings to their descendants. Our house resembles a settlement in Sumba and depicts the rich culture behind the aboriginal Indonesian tribes. Built as an authentic reproduction with a modern twist, we have taken the traditional grain storage above the fire pit and converted it into an extra room with air-conditioned beds. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle, the Sumba House is ideal for a unique couple or family getaway. Sitting in the house brings you a real sense of peace and harmony. This house can accommodate up to a maximum of 4 adventurers (though note that there is only 1 bathroom) and the rate includes breakfast and afternoon tea for all parties staying.
strTitle: Experience an overnight stay in a Sumbanese bamboo house

strIntroduction: Whatever equipment you have, whether its your mobile phone or professional DSLR, come with me to explore Bali and capture its hidden beauty. This tour is fully customisable and guided by me, so I will do my best to help you find the perfect lighting, angles and composition to make your photos unforgettable. Pick up can be arranged at your desired time, and here are some of the scenes we could shoot: - Sunrise at Sanur Beach - Sunset at Tanah Lot - Traditional Market at Bedugul - Sunrise at Bedugul Temple - Hindu Ceremony at Tirta Empul Temple (occasionally) For a feel of the kinds of photos I like to take, take a look at my portfolio here: http://ditya.deviantart.com
strTitle: Bali Photography Tour - Capture the Beauty of Bali

strIntroduction: We welcome you to the holistic haven of Sidemen, a peaceful village close to East Bali, with a four day/three night program dedicated to health and rejuvenation. Wherever you are staying in Bali, our friendly driver will come to collect you from any point you desire and will whisk you away to our favorite place in Bali - the charming village of Sidemen. Time seems to slow down in this unique spiritual pace. You have to experience it to understand what we mean! Our signature drink of rosella tea will welcome you upon your arrival and you can spend that first day relaxing by our pool and soaking in the soothing atmosphere of the area. A healthy afternoon tea and dinner overlooking the peaceful countryside complete your day. Fall asleep that evening to the sounds of nature as you ease into your rejuvenating holiday with us. An early morning yoga and meditation session on Day 2 will help you welcome the sun, followed by breakfast with healthy food of your choice ranging from sattvika to vegan. Once you are done with breakfast, go on a leisurely trek with our local guide as he brings you to cross several shallow rivers and takes you up some of Bali's most beautiful rice terraces. Marvel at the majestic Mount Agung, the tallest peak on the island, which towers over it all. No jostling tourists here, just friendly locals greeting you with a smile. Back at the villa, a refreshing young coconut awaits, before you tuck into a healthy and light lunch at our restaurant overlooking local farms. Later that afternoon, a 60 minute traditional Balinese massage is prepared for you in our spa pavilion overlooking the countryside, so you get to relax completely while you enjoy the sounds of nature. Dinner is flexible and you can choose your own location for the healthy version of our Balinese Rijsttafel - a sumptuous spread of Balinese dishes with rice. Day 3 is the most exciting, as we prepare to take you on a spiritual journey to the temple for a purification ceremony after morning yoga and breakfast. A delicious picnic lunch of salads, sandwiches and fresh fruit is set up at secluded beach. Back at the villa, an amazing Chakra massage is applied to awaken your seven chakras of life through gentle yet deep strokes from our experienced therapist. Dinner featuring sattvika cuisine will close your great day to a deep sleep.... Before you leave us on your last and final day, you can enjoy your breakfast and prepare to return back to your hotel or airport: Day 1 : Afternoon: Arrival at Cepik Villa 16.00: Afternoon tea 19.00: Healthy Dinner Day 2 : 06.00: Meditation and Yoga 07.00: Healthy breakfast 08.00: Rice terraces walk and village visit 12.00: Lunch 15.00: Traditional Balinese massage 17.00: Afternoon tea 19.00: Healthy Dinner Day 3 06.00: Meditation and Yoga 07.00: Healthy breakfast 08.00: Spiritual journey & mind purification (including picnic lunch on a private beach) 16.00: Chakra massage 17.30: Afternoon tea 20.00: Healthy Dinner Day 4 06.00: Meditation and Yoga Anytime: Healthy breakfast 12.00: Departure NOTE: The price for this retreat depends on the time of year, so select your option accordingly: High Season: Dec 23 - Jan 10 Peak Season: July 1 - Sept 15 Low season: All other dates MENUS - We are happy to cater for various diets: - Vegan menu for strict vegetarians: sweet potatoes, sauteed vegetables and fruits. - For those looking for a Satvikk diet or Yoga diet, we provide calming food that excludes garlic, onions, shallots and of course meats, poultry and fish. These ingredients we serve are strong in helping you develop clarity, purity and equanimity of mind, while also being beneficial to the body. Some examples are: water, cereal grains, legumes, vegetables, fruits, nuts, unpasteurized and unhomogenized fresh milk, butter, cream, ghee, yoghurt/lassi, cottage cheese and raw honey. - Our regular breakfast menu includes Indonesian favorites as well as an American breakfast consisting of toast, jam/preserves, honey, two eggs(any style), bacon or sausages, juices and coffee or tea.
strTitle: 4D/3N Yoga Retreat in Bali-Visit the Magical Sidemen Village

strIntroduction: One alluring factor about Bali is how strong its culture and history is. Yet, sadly it is often under appreciated and seldom understood. This tour takes you to explore Balinese local art located in exclusive collections and artist studios during which our local and knowledgable guides will tell you stories collected from locals through the years This enchanted journey takes you through the past and the present of Balinese culture and history in an interactive and artistic way; a kind of experience you’ll find is hard to obtain here in Bali. Of course, an art tour wouldn’t be complete without a museum visit. With this tour, you will go to the ARMA museum as well as enter the studios of local renowned artists like Made Wianta, Made Djirna and Agung Mangu Putra. Not only do you get to admire and view their art pieces, but keen to share their world of art and symbols, they are there to take your questions about their pieces as well as Bali’s art culture and history. Come on this cultural experience with us and learn about this special but important side of Bali!
strTitle: Experience Balinese Art and Culture with Artists

strIntroduction: Come aboard the Dragoon130, a luxury yacht, and experience sailing through the Balinese islands in style. Why settle for anything less! Whether you choose to spend just 1 day or a week on the yacht, you know it's going to be an experience you won't forget. Just imagine waking up on this yacht alongside your friends and family and having an unprecedented view of the waters and islands of Bali. Once an Indonesian cargo ship, Italian architect designers have refurbished it into a gorgeous yacht by using its original teak and ironwood panelling and adding a state-of-the-art cockpit and jacuzzi pool on the upper deck, a swanky bar, restaurant and entertainment lounge on the lower deck, and six luxurious air-conditioned cabins with all the modern amenities you ask for. The idea behind this redesigning is to encourage not only the recycling of materials but to support the use of local materials. Accommodation: The Dragoon consists of 6 luxurious cabins, complete with all the extras, to spend alone or with friends a wonderful holiday in one of the last paradises in the world. The guests can use all facilities: cinema, restaurant, swimming pool and take advantage of all the existing spaces to relax or do yoga. - 2 master cabins - 2 double cabins - 2 standard cabins All cabins are private bathroom, air-conditioned, fridge, with en-suite facilities, and all have LCD TVs. The captain of the boat and all the crew, will always be at your service at any time. For 1 day and 1 week private charters, pick up can be arranged from Bali, Lombok or the Gili Islands (hotel transfers to the boat will be provided as well)
strTitle: Spend a Day Sailing Around Bali on a Luxury Yacht

strIntroduction: Finally a chance for you to live out your hollywood dreams of riding into the sea with horses just like in Lord of Rings and the Chronicles of Narnia! Whatever your experience level is, you'll be able to enjoy this unique experience that will definitely make your friends gasp with jealousy. ITINERARY: - Start from the stables - Visit the Turtle Conservation Centre (15 minutes) - Ride by the Beach - Swimming with the Horses (Around 30 minutes) - Ride back to the Stables You can also opt for our premium package that is a combination of below activities: 1. horse ride (2 hours) 2. jet ski 3. flying fish 4. Banana boat ride for 2 pax 5. Return transport
strTitle: Go Horse Riding into the Sea and Swim with the horses

strIntroduction: Laughing therapy is a healing technique that combines breathing, meditation, and laughter. Scientific studies have proven that laughing for 10-20 minutes a day has many beneficial effects on the body. Laughing exercises, followed by good yoga breathing techniques can improve oxygen flow and improve your body's immune system. Laughing therapy is believed to be able to open seven chakras (energy points) in the human body. Through this laughter therapy, participants can expect to develop a healthy body, mind, and soul. In this activity, participants will be trained to execute controlled laughter, such as "ha .. ha … ha …, ho … ho … ho …, he … he … he …, hi … hi … hi …" and others. Each kind of laughter contains its own healing properties. In addition to training the various types of laugh, participants will also be invited to dance together, and perform meditation and some yoga. This program will be combined with a day tour to Ubud Royal Palace and Goa Gajah Temple to make the most of your day to Ubud. ITINERARY: 08.00: Hotel pick up 09.30 – 10.30: Laughing Therapy and Meditation with spiritual healer Made Sumbara in his famous Ambarashram near Ubud 11.00 – 12.00: Ubud Royal Palace and Goa Gajah Temple (Elephant cave temple) visit 12.30 – 13.30 Lunch 15.00 Arrive in Hotel
strTitle: Heal Yourself with Laughing Therapy and Meditation

strIntroduction: Located in Klungkung regency in East Bail, Kusamba village is famous for its local industry - salt farming. The salts are produced traditionally by the local people using primitive tools and is a painstaking process. The salts produced are high-quality, with grains of coarse salt and high iodine content. While other tours take you to see how this is done, we give you the chance to EXPERIENCE the process for yourself and make your very own salt. There are only 15 traditional farmers left in the village, and during this experience, you will get to work with some of them. Our itinerary: 07.00: Pick up from your hotel. We go directly to the workshop location in the Kusamba village 09.00: Arrive in Kusamba 09.00 - 16.00: We go through the steps of making your own salt, with a lunch break in between to taste local specialities - WATERING BEACH SAND. Sea sand that used for the salt processing should be watered with seawater - POURING SEAWATER FOR CRYSTALLISATION PROCESS. Raw material for making salt is seawater that has been filtered as much as 3 times. - INTRODUCTION TO THE TRADITIONAL TOOLS FOR SALT MAKING PROCESS. The farmers still use natural materials such as coconut trunk, coconut bark, wood and bamboo - LUNCH WITH SALT FARMER WITH A SPECIAL MENU OF KUSAMBA. We will serve the Kusamba Special lunch menu, made from fresh fish caught by local fishermen. They season the fish with their own salt, so you get a taste of what it's like. There is even a vegetable called Serombotan which is native to the area, which you get to taste. Pepes is a popular local dish of the regency as well. - COLLECTING SAND. Sand that has been watered and dried will be taking to use as a seawater filter - TAKING SEAWATER. Taking back the sea water to be filtered using a beach sand that has been dried in the sun - HARVESTING. Harvesting only can be done after seawater is exposed to scorching sunlight and the seawater has crystallized into a salt Besides the salt-making, there is a traditional fish market where many local fishermen sell and trade their fresh fish catches. We will bring you to see the traditional fish processing methods in this area.
strTitle: Salt-Making with the Salt Farmers of Kusamba

strIntroduction: In the years preceding the 1920s, Balinese traditional paintings were restricted to what is now known as the Kamasan or Wayang style. Kamasan style is a unique art form in Bali originating from Ubud. It serves as a visual-narrative, usually telling a story within a refined and ornamental piece of art. In this workshop, you will learn about classical Kamasan-style painting depicting characters from the famous Ramayana and Mahabhrata stories. An instructor will guide you step-by-step through every detail and help you create your own Kamasan-style painting.
strTitle: Create Your Own Kamasan-style Wayang Painting

strIntroduction: Batik is a technique of manual wax-resist dyeing applied to whole cloth, or cloth made using this technique. The tradition of making batik is found in various countries, including Nigeria, China, India, Malaysia,Philippines and Sri Lanka, but the batik of Indonesia is the most well-known. Indonesian batik has a long history of acculturation, with diverse patterns influenced by a variety of cultures, and is the most developed in terms of pattern, technique, and the quality of workmanship. On October 2009, it was even designated by UNESCO as a Masterpiece of Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity. If you're interested in learning more about Indonesia’s most famous traditional arts, this is the class for you! During these 7 hours, you will become familiar with this ancient textiles technique while making your own design. We will make your batik by drawing dots and lines with wax using a spouted tool called a canting. The applied wax resists dyes and therefore allows us to color selectively by soaking the cloth in one color, removing the wax with boiling water, and repeating if multiple colors are desired. We will provide you a cloth with a frame when you arrive and let you draw your own design. At the end of the class, you'll have your own batik to take home! Available: Every day at 9am.
strTitle: Learn to Make Your Own Batik

strIntroduction: Traditional Balinese masks can be most commonly seen on dancers in traditional dance performances or on Ogoh-Ogohs (Balinese statues) during the eve of Nyepi. During this three-hour course, you will learn about the meaning of the different Balinese masks, while creating and coloring your own wooden mask with the help of a professional teacher. At the beginning of the class, we'll show you a list of photos from different masks and you can pick the one that you'd like to make. Once you choose the mask shape, you can decorate the mask with oil painting to bring the character to life. You can accessorize your own mask with moustache, eyebrows etc to make it even more realistic! Available: Every day at 9.30am and 1pm.
strTitle: Paint Your Own Traditional Balinese Mask

strIntroduction: Shadow puppets are a traditional form of entertainment in Bali which originated from Java. Shadow puppet performances, or "Wayang", are often accompanied by a Gamelan musical orchestra in order to tell a story. In this special one day class, carve and paint a shadow puppet from leather while learning about the form and function of the most important puppets. First, we make a sketch of the puppet you'd like to create on leather - you can either copy a design we have, or make your own. You will draw out the different parts of the puppet, including the face, its arms, and body. Then, we use a hammer and chisel to carve out the shape and colour the shape using acrylic paint. Finally, we attach the sticks and string to the appropriate parts of the puppet so that the puppet can move. You now have your own masterpiece to show your family and friends! Availability: Every day at 9.30am
strTitle: Make Your Own Shadow Puppets

strIntroduction: If you want to feel like a prince or princess, this is a special experience that us locals enjoy when we are getting married - getting dressed up in traditional wedding outfits, or as we call it, Payas Agung. Because it is a special occasion, we put in extra effort to accessorize with necklaces, rings, bracelets etc to exude a royal aura. For this experience, we will bring you to a special Payas Agung salon and boutique where you can choose from a range of outfits with different colours and styles. The most beautiful part of this outfit is the elaborate golden headdress which is just spectacular. Once you are all dolled up, we will take care of your makeup at the salon, then bring you to a beautiful temple to take pictures for a lasting memento of Bali. ITINERARY: 09.00: Pickup from your hotel (regardless of location) 09.00 - 10.30: Arrive in salon, choose outfit and get makeup done. 10.30: We bring you to Batuan village which has a beautiful temple complex that will serve as a backdrop for your photoshoot. After the shoot, we bring you back to your hotel. ARRIVAL TIMES AT THE SALON: Ubud: 9.30am Kuta/Seminyak: 10.15am Jimbaran/Nusa Dua: 10.30am
strTitle: Photoshoot in Formal Balinese Wedding Outfit - Payas Agung

strIntroduction: This is a "real life stay". It's about discovering a sense of belonging within you through experiencing and tasting life. You "work out to work out your life", this is a Lifestyle Crossfit™ that fits. Through our exploration and guidance of lifestyle artistry and activities, you will be able find a fit that looks good on you, that you can take with you and that is worthy of you. Be the best version of you and find home in your unique paradise of existence, whilst you live it out in paradise. Inclusive of guided activities and transport. Including temples, motivational volcano climbs and surfing. All wellness and fitness programs servicing twice daily and all food and beverage, excluding alcohol. Double occupancy can also be arranged. Also, there are variances available for lower based inclusive experience stay, please don't hesitate to ask for these options, as we are here to accommodate you and your desired lifestyle experience.
strTitle: Redefine you and your Life 5D/4N Lifestyle Retreat

strIntroduction: Relax, have fun & immerse into wellness and life itself through Yoga, Meditation, Self & Lifestyle Therapy, Water Therapy, Dance, Surfing, Reiki Healing, SUP (stand up paddle) & Beach Fitness, Cooking, Community Aid & Local Tradition in Eco Luxury. Indulge in massage, spa treatments, vibrating whole foods with unlimited juices, tonics, wine and cocktails by the poolside or on the candlelit rooftop. From sunrise to sunset, you will be experiencing Bali's best whilst feeling the best version of you. Join us for the life in style that is worthy of you and looks divine on you.
strTitle: Immerse in you and yourself in a Life in Style 5D/4N Retreat

strIntroduction: If you'd like to share a special romantic moment during your time in Bali, our delicious 7-course menu, served in your own private gazebo on the grounds of our intimate resort bordering Ubud, will make you feel like a true prince and princess! We prepare all flowers and candles around the pool. We also provide live Balinese rindik music to make this a night to remember. The 7-course meal includes below local delicacies: - Pepes Udang - Steamed shrimp in Balinese paste wrapped with banana leaves - Cramcam - Clear chicken soup boiled with young papaya, lemongrass, lime leaves and fried shallots - Jukut Pelecing Kangkung - Steamed water spinach with peanuts, crackers and tomato chilli sauce - Lime Sorbet - A great palate cleanser Choice of main course: - Crispy Duck - Deep fried crispy duck served with vegetable urab and fragrant steamed rice or - Balinese pork ribs - Grilled pork ribs served with vegetable wrap and rice - Trio Jajan Bali - 3 kinds of Balinese cakes - Sagon Bali - sweet dessert made from sticky rice topped with coconut and palm sugar - Coffee or tea
strTitle: Starlight Candlelight Dinner in a Private Gazebo

strIntroduction: The south of Lombok is famous for it's pristine white-sand beaches, which easily rank among Indonesia's finest. If you're looking to discover a slice of paradise, this fully customizable tour is a great way to explore Lombok's stunning south! In addition to bringing you to some of the most beautiful beaches we know, we make stops to several handicraft villages for you to get a peek at the indigenous Sasak culture. Our tour includes several stops (though everything is customizable!): 1. Tanjung Aa'n beach - the best beach in Lombok (in our opinion), with a beautiful crescent moon bay surrounded by emerald-green hills 2. Kuta beach - not to be confused with Bali's busy stretch, this is the white sandy beach of your dreams with transparent blue-green water. The scenery is spectacular, with cliffs and mountains reaching the coast to create jagged and awe- inspiring landscapes and views. 3. A pottery village called Banyumulek 4. A weaving village called Sukarare village 5. A traditional village called Rambitan village 6. Lunch in Kuta for delicious seafood Alternatively, if you'd like to visit the north, we can also bring you on our village & rice paddy tour in Central Lombok, which includes a stop at: - Benang Stokel and Benang Kelambu Twin Waterfalls - beautiful lush vegetation surrounds these gorgeous waterfalls which the locals believe possess curative qualities (1.5 hours from Senggigi) - A weaving village called Pringgasela. - Tete Batu rice fields with a backdrop of Mount RInjani in the distance (there are some beautiful restaurants with great views here!)
strTitle: Full Day Tour of South Lombok - Beaches & Culture

strIntroduction: I will bring you to the most scenic spots in Bali where you can take the most unforgettable and beautiful photographs together with your loved one. A photographer and camera crew will assist in taking all photographs during the entire pre-wedding or couple photoshoot in Bali. We will then edit the photos and compile them into an acrylic album which you can keep as a memorable souvenir, or use for your pre-wedding photograph display. If you select the Silver package, we will also provide a traditional Balinese gown/dress for you to take photos in, for a more authentic feel of Bali. Some of the places that we might bring you for the photoshoot include: -Tanah Lot Temple beach -Jatiluwih Rice Terraces -Uluwatu cliffs And many others, Bali has no shortage of scenic locations for photoshoots. Take beautiful wedding photos in Bali with us, we look forward to eternalizing your best memories for you.
strTitle: Shoot Wedding/Couple Photos in Bali

strIntroduction: Learn to windsurf with us in Bali! Windsurfing is an age-old favourite watersport which combines surfing and sailing to allow you to glide over the surface of the water. Level 1 Beginning with a beach simulation, we will teach you all you need to know about equipment preparation and making the launch before moving into the water. You will learn start techniques, sail recovery, acceleration, how to turn the board, and how to move up and down wind. Level 2 Slip into a harness and take your windsurfing to the next level. We will teach the speed skills essential for learners to move up into jibes and deepwater starts. You will also learn how to read wind pattern and how to manage your sail using the harness and essential foot placement for planning at speed. Level 3 Learn how to make S turns, rail turns, and downwind speed turns used in racing. Once you master the basics, you will move up to a pro board and use the foot straps to demonstrate speedwork and direction changes under power with the harness.
strTitle: Learn to Windsurf in Bali

strIntroduction: Night Surfing at Keramas Beach in Bali is a sport that challenges and thrills surfers from around the world. Surfing in the day is difficult enough when you can actually see the waves coming in. Think you're a proficient surfer? Now, time to try surfing at night! This is the only night surfing facility in the world - made possible thanks to the installation of 2 stadium floodlights that help provide light for a distance of 500m, and allows you to see your fellow surfers around you. Experienced night surfers say that night surfing so surreal, like surfing in a dream-like fantasy. Everything is dark despite the light provided from the floodlights and you must really be able to feel the wave as if you were surfing blindfolded. But feeling the wind in your face as you manage to catch a 4 foot wave in darkness is simply electrifying! You are invited for a free warm up session at around 5pm to test the waves at Keramas beach before the actual night surfing. The lifeguard will give a briefing about the conditions for the night, and you will need to sign an indemnity form. After which, there are 3 sessions of 1h night surfing that you can select, usually between 7pm-10pm depending on the tide for the day. There are 3 lifeguards on duty to ensure safety and give advice at all times, however they are not instructors. A maximum of 6 people will be allowed to surf at one session. Be careful of sea urchins in the water as Keramas beach lies atop a sharp volcanic reef. Night surfing is only encouraged for intermediate to advanced surfers. Beginner surfers are free to try night surfing, but do take note of the risks involved. You are free to bring your own surfboard or rent a short surfboard from our shed. Family & friends of the surfers can enjoy the pool and beachside mattresses at the beach club while watching your surfer friend ride the waves during this spectacular night surfing!
strTitle: Enjoy Spectacular Night Surfing at Keramas Beach

strIntroduction: "Melukat", or karmic cleansing ritual ceremony, is part of the Manusa Yadnya ceremony (holy sacrifice dedicated to human beings). Melukat aims to cleanse and purify the human body and soul in order to prevent havoc, bad luck and sickness. This havoc comes from acquired sins from your past life (sancita karmaphala) and actions from your present life (prarabda karmaphala). The ‘melukat’ ritual is a means of achieving self-purification for your physical body and spiritual soul. These efforts should be sought in accordance with the Lontar (palm leaf scriptures) ”Dharma Kahuripan” which describes how human spiritual maintenance is to be cared for from the womb until the end of life. The Melukat ceremony can be performed many times, according to your situation, needs, and goals. There are 6 different types of Melukat ceremonies: 1. Melukat Astupungku Aims to cleanse and purify one’s evil influence caused by the imbalance of 3 material energies: Satwam, rajas, and tamas. It is in accordance with the instructions in Lontar Astupungku. 2. Melukat Gni Anglayang To provide medical treatment for persosn afflicted with disease. This ritual Implementation is done by a Balian who performs traditional treatments in accordance with’Lontar Putusan Kala Gni Chandra Bhairawa’. 3. Melukat Gomana For redemption of your day of birth and from bad influences through your life. 4. Melukat Surya Gomana To remove ‘stains’ and ‘dirt’ on a new born baby. This ceremony is held at birth, 3 days after birth, and 3 months after birth. 5. Melukat Semara Beda For cleansing the groom and bride from 'stains' and 'dirt' in a traditional Balinese wedding ceremony. 6. Melukat Nawa Ratna A ceremony for glory and prosperity from your leaders when you perform your duties.
strTitle: Participate in a Karmic Cleansing Ritual Ceremony

strIntroduction: See, feel, and experience the spiritual aspect of the lives of local Balinese on this unique tour. Join me to see the Full Moon (or New Moon) ceremony at a local village temple in Bali. On this tour, you will be invited to be a part of the local people's ceremony. You will carry offerings on your head, dress in traditional Balinese clothes, and pray together with the local Balinese. If we are lucky, we might even be able to join a parade around the village! Why is it called the full moon and new moon ceremony? Because according to our Hindu beliefs, the best time to worship God is during the full moon as the power of God is much stronger blessing all creatures on Earth during this time. NOTE: Because this tour is reliant on the lunar calendar, please send me a message to determine the most suitable date. Photo credits: https://flic.kr/p/78c9md https://flic.kr/p/78c94y
strTitle: Experience a Balinese Full Moon or New Moon Ceremony

strIntroduction: This adventure is recognized as one of the top in Bali for those who like adventure, sports, fun, and discovery. You will start your trip with an awesome ATV (or 'quad' bike) adventure in the middle of beautiful ricefields terraces. As you drive, you might start to feel as if you're in a postcard, but it’s real! You will also experience the "Bali jungle" and pass through a small river, eventually stopping at amazing natural hot springs. For a lovely panorama and cultural detour, we'll stop to savor a “Bali Kopi” (typical Balinese coffee) and visit a small rustic farmer's house. After a little bit more than 1.5 hours, we will arrive at a lovely restaurant where you will enjoy a typical Balinese lunch overlooking scenic rice terraces. After lunch, we will leave the Batukaru region and stop at the lovely Bali Butterfly Park for a short visit on the way back to your hotel. All Balinese come here to contribute the butterflies, cocoons and caterpillars they find, so you will see an amazing variety of butterflies. Some will even be bigger than your hand! NOTE: You can drive the ATV's “single” (in Bali you need to be at least 15 years old to drive one ATV), or do it with someone else as “tandem”. 3 DEPARTURES A DAY: NUSA DUA 07.00 09.00 11.00 SANUR 07.00 09.00 11.00 UBUD 07.30 09.30 11.30 KUTA 07.30 09.30 11.30 PRICE INCLUDES: Welcome drink Water during the tour One Bali coffee Balinese lunch (excluding drinks) All the tours and visits Hotel return transport for minimum 2 persons
strTitle: Ride an ATV through the Ricefields & Visit Butterfly Park

strIntroduction: Java is a highly populated place, but we can still bring you to the lesser known places with wonderful things to see, places you can only have access to with the right connections. This tour is all about nature and culture. Here are some highlights that you can expect: -Borobudur: The biggest Hindu temple in Indonesia -Merapi Volcano: A volcano that's close to the city and home to interesting species of flora and fauna -Get up close and personal with reptiles (King Cobras, etc) in Yogjakarta, with the guide of our friends in the region, the reptile enthusiasts -Night spotting for snakes, lizards, civet cats, and other wildlife
strTitle: Yogyakarta Reptile Tour (2D/1N)

strIntroduction: Join us for an adventure to see Orangutans in Tanjung Puting National Park in Kalimantan, Borneo. We know Kalimantan like the back of our hand, travelling back there every year to visit other conservation groups and a few different places to enjoy what this beautiful island has to offer. Tanjung Puting National Park is famous for its Orangutan rehabilitation program. It has a mostly flat terrain and is home to both wild and rehabilitated Orangutans. There are also many types of flora and fauna to see that you can only find with the right guides. Finding the right guides is our specialty and every tour is designed to be very flexible to suit the needs of each group. -----ITINERARY----- A typical Kalimantan tour will start and finish in Bali. The night before the tour starts, we will meet up in Bali to get to know each other. Next morning, we will fly to Surabaya and then to Pangkalan Bun where we meet our first guide and travel by boat to Tanjung Puting. We will travel into the park by a river boat (klotok). We will travel slowly in order to enhance the opportunities to see both salt water and gavial crocodiles plus many other animals such as proboscis and silver leaf monkeys, macaques and birds. We will eat and sleep aboard the klotok in comfortable surroundings, during which we will visit both the rehabilitation facility and trek into the jungle to look at other wildlife. You will get the chance to be up close and personal with some magnificent wildlife in a protected area. We will take you into parts of the park few others get the chance to visit on night spotting trips which will turn up some amazing finds, so bring a camera! After, it's back to Pangkalan Bun as we'll be flying to Banjarmasin where we will stay for one night with a local family and meet with groups of young Indonesian conservationists, before heading into the jungle the next morning. -----MORE DETAILS----- Each tour goes into a different area but each area is equally as spectacular with similar habitats, flora and fauna. We select areas using the knowledge of local guides and hunters who know where the best places to visit will be. This will improve the chances of finding seasonal flora and fauna as required. So far, every base camp has been located beside a river where you can swim, as well as set right beside the jungle with access to various wildlife trails for exploring the area. Night spotting in these areas turns up many unexpected results. Our cook is great and she does a wonderful job under what can be difficult circumstances at times. Our guides vary from place to place because we use the best guide for each area and our porters are all local people. Base camp one is our main operations point and will be chosen based on easy access to different places we know will be of interest.
strTitle: See Wild Orangutans in Kalimantan Jungle, Borneo

strIntroduction: Begin this beautifying treat with a steam bath to open your pores so as to better assist nutrient infusions. Your choice of body scrub follows, gently slough off the dead skin cells. Have a quick rinse and sink into the bed as the therapist massages and melts your tensions away. A 60-minute facial or your choice (Pevonia or Clarins) makes it all perfect; or if nourishing hair treatment is your preference, it is all yours! All spas will start with a drink of ginger tea to improve blood circulation, and a traditional foot bath ritual to cleanse your feet. Please indicate if you prefer facial or hair treatment during your booking.
strTitle: Beautifying Spa Package (Facial, Massage, Hair)
